title: (11) - Incoming and Outcoming. (Corrected once)
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\text{M}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\text{N}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are respectively points on the circumscribed circle and incircle of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\square{\\text{ABCD}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Calculate the value of"}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\large \\dfrac{\\text{MA}^4 + \\text{MB}^4 + \\text{MC}^4 + \\text{MD}^4}{2(\\text{NA}^2\\text{NC}^2 + \\text{NB}^2\\text{ND}^2)}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]}]}

title: 11 is a good divisor!
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A number has 2014 digits in decimal representation, and leaves a remainder 5 when divided by 11."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What is the remainder when the same number formed by "},{"type":"text","text":"reversing","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":" it's digits is divided by 11?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Details and Assumptions","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\bullet"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Number formed by reversing digits of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"12345"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"54321"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\bullet"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0123"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a 3-digit number, not "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digit."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is a part of the set 11≡ awesome (mod remainders) "}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The divisibility by 11 rule is to add every other number starting from the first digit, then subtract every other number starting from the second and if the difference between the two is divisible by 11, the original number is divisible by 11.  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let us call the sum of every other number from the first a and from the second b.  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a-b\equiv 5 \pmod{11} \therefore b-a\equiv -5 \equiv 6 \pmod{11}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"NOTE: if this number had an odd number of digits, then if the number was flipped the remainder wouldn't change. Eg abc: a+c-b, cba: c+a-b."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Good solution, just an addition that what you used for (mod 11) was type the same in LaTeX wrapping, but there is a code for that too, I've edited that in your solution. Please see the change made , see that from the "pencil" icon and then see how it works."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\pmod{11} appears as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\pmod{11}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"One of the property of 11"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"when the digits are odd the remainder is going to be same when the no is reversed while"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"when the digits are even  then the summation of remainder of original no and the reversed no gives 11"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"hence 11-5=6."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1+1 no longer equals to 2

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/3Xf33ZnuM3-binary-sum-solution.jpg?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In binary base system, only digits 1 & 0 can be used with the value doubling in the next larger unit. That means, in this case, 1+1 = 10 ("},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10_{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2_{10}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then in the addition above, 1+0 = 1 as in decimal process, but when it's 1+1 = 10, the digit 1 (red) will be added up to the next larger unit, leaving 0 down as shown. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"As a result, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1011010_{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" + "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"110011_{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10001101_{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now converting the binary number to decimal one by summation of their unit values, we will get:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10001101_{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" + "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" + "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" + "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" = 141."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
